description:
Chromium fork for Windows XP/2003 and up An up-to-date Chromium-based web browser compatible with Windows XP, 2003, Vista, 7 and 8.x. The Supermium web browser also provides the following features: - Aero Glass and Aero Glass-style titlebars instead of Windows 10-style ones (#force-xp-theme in chrome://flags for the latter) - Turnaround for major vulnerability patches generally less than one week from upstream disclosure - A functional sandbox for enhanced security - Google Sync - On Windows 7 and up, Widevine CDM support for viewing DRM content - GDI font rendering, using #force-gdi in chrome://flags - Persistent dark mode on the browser's UI elements, using #force-dark-mode in chrome://flags - Custom tab options including trapezoidal tabs, transparent tabs, and outlined tabs - Many flags from ungoogled-chromium - Support for SSE2-only processors in the 32 bit build Future support for: - Windows 2000 - Ungoogled Chromium features (in progress) - WebGPU for D3D9 renderer - Manifest V2 (once removed by Google) ...and more! If there's a feature you want, which cannot be replicated by a Manifest v2/v3 extension, please ask! The Chromium base was updated from 126.0.6478.254 to 126.0.6478.256 to reflect the ESR patches in the recent period. Other changes include: (#1008) - Crash when using user agent overrides via developer tools resolved (#1005) - Introduced #disable-ech flag for accessing websites that may need ECH disabled to visit (#1003) - Browser will no longer crash when pressing the right arrow key on an autocomplete suggestion containing certain characters (#977) - Restored #media-dial-route-provider flag (#635, #636, #842) - Look of tab search button revised to match Chrome 109 and earlier when using Aero Glass. The button will also become available with the "XP theme". (#1001, #959) - Printing issues with PDF files resolved (#916) - Improved PDF fallback on Windows 7 - see https://github.com/win32ss/pdfium for details
